rename.from: `RCLONE_` prefixed environment variables for string array options not working in v1.68.0
rename.to: `RCLONE_` prefixed environment variables for multi-valued options not working in v1.68.0

issue.title: DigitalOcean setup with env variables is not working anymore

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Setting up DigitalOcean (at least) doesn't work using environment variables anymore since v.1.68.0

Note that I have no issue when the exact same parameters are set in the config file (`~/.config/rclone/rclone.conf`). 

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
# rclone --version
rclone v1.68.0
- os/version: debian 12.4 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.1.0-22-amd64 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.23.1
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```

and

```
Â» ./rclone --version
rclone v1.68.0
- os/version: arch (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.10.7-arch1-1 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.23.1
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none

```

Note that the same setup **works** fine with the version **v1.67.0**.

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

Linux amd64, debian, ubuntu and arch

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

DigitalOcean

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

Any command that access the remove storage. In my use case: `ls` and `sync`.

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
# rclone ls do:EDIT-MY-BUCKET -vv
2024/09/11 13:05:00 DEBUG : Setting --s3-provider "DigitalOcean" from environment variable RCLONE_S3_PROVIDER="DigitalOcean"
2024/09/11 13:05:00 DEBUG : Setting --s3-access-key-id "EDIT" from environment variable RCLONE_S3_ACCESS_KEY_ID="EDIT"
2024/09/11 13:05:00 DEBUG : Setting --s3-secret-access-key "EDIT" from environment variable RCLONE_S3_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY="EDIT"
2024/09/11 13:05:00 DEBUG : Setting --s3-endpoint "fra1.digitaloceanspaces.com" from environment variable RCLONE_S3_ENDPOINT="fra1.digitaloceanspaces.com"
2024/09/11 13:05:00 DEBUG : Setting --s3-acl "public-read" from environment variable RCLONE_S3_ACL="public-read"
2024/09/11 13:05:00 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.68.0" starting with parameters ["rclone" "ls" "do:EDIT-MY-BUCKET" "-vv"]
2024/09/11 13:05:00 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "do:EDIT-MY-BUCKET"
2024/09/11 13:05:00 DEBUG : Using config file from "/root/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2024/09/11 13:05:00 DEBUG : do: detected overridden config - adding "{XHDCm}" suffix to name
2024/09/11 13:05:00 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "do:EDIT-MY-BUCKET" to be canonical "do{XHDCm}:EDIT-MY-BUCKET"
SDK 2024/09/11 13:05:00 WARN falling back to IMDSv1: operation error ec2imds: getToken, http response error StatusCode: 405, request to EC2 IMDS failed
2024/09/11 13:05:00 DEBUG : 4 go routines active
2024/09/11 13:05:00 NOTICE: Failed to ls: directory not found
```

My config file: 
```
[do]
type = s3
env_auth = true
```

Environment variables set:
```
export RCLONE_S3_ACCESS_KEY_ID=EDIT
export RCLONE_S3_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=EDIT
export RCLONE_S3_ENDPOINT=EDIT
export RCLONE_S3_PROVIDER=DigitalOcean
```

<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the ðŸ‘ [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

body:
This appears to be broken for all variables of type `[]string`. This was broken in the recent config re-organisation

```
$ git grep '\[\]string.*config:'
cmd/mountlib/mount.go:  ExtraOptions       []string      `config:"option"`
cmd/mountlib/mount.go:  ExtraFlags         []string      `config:"fuse_flag"`
cmd/serve/dlna/dlnaflags/dlnaflags.go:  InterfaceNames   []string    `config:"interface"`
cmd/serve/sftp/sftp.go: HostKeys       []string `config:"key"`             // Paths to private host keys
fs/config.go:   CompareDest                []string          `config:"compare_dest"`
fs/config.go:   CopyDest                   []string          `config:"copy_dest"`
fs/config.go:   DisableFeatures            []string          `config:"disable"`
fs/config.go:   CaCert                     []string          `config:"ca_cert"`     // Client Side CA
fs/filter/filter.go:    ExcludeFile    []string      `config:"exclude_if_present"`
fs/filter/filter.go:    FilesFrom      []string      `config:"files_from"`
fs/filter/filter.go:    FilesFromRaw   []string      `config:"files_from_raw"`
fs/filter/rules.go:     FilterRule  []string `config:"filter"`
fs/filter/rules.go:     FilterFrom  []string `config:"filter_from"`
fs/filter/rules.go:     ExcludeRule []string `config:"exclude"`
fs/filter/rules.go:     ExcludeFrom []string `config:"exclude_from"`
fs/filter/rules.go:     IncludeRule []string `config:"include"`
fs/filter/rules.go:     IncludeFrom []string `config:"include_from"`
lib/http/server.go:     ListenAddr         []string      `config:"addr"`                 // Port to listen on
```

Can you have a go with this please? I think this should fix the problem


[v1.69.0-beta.8303.a5a85ab29.fix-8063-config](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-8063-config/v1.69.0-beta.8303.a5a85ab29.fix-8063-config/) on branch [fix-8063-config](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-8063-config) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Explanation from the commit message
    
After the config re-organisation, the setting of stringArray config values (eg `--exclude` set with `RCLONE_EXCLUDE`) was broken and gave a message like this for `RCLONE_EXCLUDE=*.jpg`:
    
    Failed to load "filter" default values: failed to initialise "filter" options:
    couldn't parse config item "exclude" = "*.jpg" as []string: parsing "*.jpg" as []string failed:
    invalid character '/' looking for beginning of value
    
This was caused by the parser trying to parse the input string as a JSON value.
    
When the config was re-organised it was thought that the internal representation of stringArray values was not important as it was never visible externally, however this turned out not to be true.
    
A defined representation was chosen - a comma separated string and this was documented and tests were introduced in this patch.
    
This potentially introduces a very small backwards incompatibility. In rclone v1.67.0
    
    RCLONE_EXCLUDE=a,b
    
Would be interpreted as
    
    --exclude "a,b"
    
Whereas this new code will interpret it as
    
    --exclude "a" --exclude "b"
    
The benefit of being able to set multiple values with an environment variable was deemed to outweigh the very small backwards compatibility risk.
    
If a value with a `,` is needed, then use CSV escaping, eg
    
    RCLONE_EXCLUDE="a,b"
    
(Note this needs to have the quotes in so at the unix shell that would be
    
    RCLONE_EXCLUDE='"a,b"'

> Can you have a go with this please? I think this should fix the problem
> 
> [v1.69.0-beta.8303.a5a85ab29.fix-8063-config](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-8063-config/v1.69.0-beta.8303.a5a85ab29.fix-8063-config/) on branch [fix-8063-config](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-8063-config) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

@ncw The link is broken...

Sorry forgot to push it... Try this

[v1.69.0-beta.8303.a5a85ab29.fix-8063-config](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-8063-config/v1.69.0-beta.8303.a5a85ab29.fix-8063-config/) on branch [fix-8063-config](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-8063-config) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
@ncw Confirmed to be fixed in the provided beta version. Thanks! Looking forward to its landing in the next release.
Thanks for testing - I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.69 and in v1.68.1

issue.title: `--rc-addr` argument for rc command not functioning as expected in v1.68.0

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

https://forum.rclone.org/t/possible-bug-with-rclone-rc-vfs-refresh-command/47678

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

`--rc-addr` argument seems broken in the latest release v1.68.0. If you it is replaced by `--url`, it works fine. Please see the details in the forum thread.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.68.0
- os/version: ubuntu 24.04 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.5.0-1027-oracle (aarch64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: arm64 (ARMv8 compatible)
- go/version: go1.23.1
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

ubuntu amd64

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

all backends

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```bash
rclone rc vfs/refresh --rc-addr=localhost:portNum
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

Please see forum link.

<!--- Please keep the note below for others who read your bug report. -->

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the ðŸ‘ [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
* Please don't comment if you have no relevant information to add. It's just extra noise for everyone subscribed to this issue.
* Subscribe to receive notifications on status change and new comments.

body:
Thanks for that @manselmi 

Unfortunately I didn't notice that forum post as I could have fixed the problem before the release! Oh well.

issue.title: CI: Fix rclone env var formatting in Windows Patches action

labels.name: Bug Fix
labels.description: Non-breaking change which fixes an issue

milestone.title: OBS Studio 31.0
milestone.description:
Items that we would like to consider for inclusion (or removal) in OBS Studio 31.0.

NOTE: Items on this list are not promised to be in the listed release, just that we are considering them. This list is subject to change at any time.

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Description

Fixes patch download failing due to a change in how rclone parses command line variables. Anything containing a comma (`,`) now needs to be quoted.

### Motivation and Context

This appeared to be a regression but according to https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/8063#issuecomment-2344718575 this is a deliberate (breaking) change. Unfortunately not documented (e.g. in the changelog).

### How Has This Been Tested?

Ran rclone 1.68 locally with new format.

### Types of changes

- Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

### Checklist:

- [x] My code has been run through [clang-format](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/.clang-format).
- [x] I have read the [**contributing** document](https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.rst).
- [x] My code is not on the master branch.
- [x] The code has been tested.
- [x] All commit messages are properly formatted and commits squashed where appropriate.
- [x] I have included updates to all appropriate documentation.
